intro: Willoughbya angulata, commonly known as the zigzagged yam, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Willoughbya angulata is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions. It plays a role in local ecosystems and has been used traditionally by Indigenous Australians for various purposes.
